definition: gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

sentences.english: BULLET a shaped projectile designed to be shot trough the rifled barrel of a gun.
sentences.chinese: 設計成一定形狀的射彈，通過制有膛線的槍管發射。

sentences.english: The albino drew a pistol from his coat and aimed the barrel through the bars, directly at the curator.
sentences.chinese: 他從外套中拔出手槍，將槍管透過鐵欄杆瞄準了館長。

sentences.english: Alas, its barrels hold only rubber bullets and darts.
sentences.chinese: 只可惜，他的槍管裏裝的是橡皮子彈和飛鏢。

sentences.english: With my tongue I can feel the silencer holes we drilled into the barrel of the gun.
sentences.chinese: 我的舌頭可以舔到槍管上我們鑿出來的一個個消音孔。

sentences.english: Bullets fired from a gun have striae based on the barrel used;
sentences.chinese: 在槍裏射出的子彈帶有槍管留下的條狀印跡。

sentences.english: The vacuum pumps begin sucking the air from the barrel of gun.
sentences.chinese: 真空泵開始抽取電子槍管裏的空氣。

sentences.english: These were bayonets and gun-barrels confusedly illuminated by the distant reflection of the torch.
sentences.chinese: 那是被火炬的光映照着的遠處的槍刺和槍管。

sentences.english: Rust had eaten out the gun barrel.
I showed her how to break the barrel and put shells in.
sentences.chinese: 我向她演示如何打開槍管和裝彈上膛。

sentences.english: The barrel of a rifle ROLLS the Bearded Man onto his back.
sentences.chinese: 一根衝鋒槍槍管將鬍渣男翻身到背面。

sentences.english: Up, she stood up to attention, with the barrel beneath her breast.
sentences.chinese: 起來，她直立起來，槍管就在胸前。

definition: to try out a new product (or manufacturing process)/prototype/trial product
